panel.title: FAQ for Check Point Analytics App for Checkpoint

li.span: Why i am not getting data in "Syslog Message" tab?
li.p: This may be because sourcetype of your syslog is different from "qos_syslog". You can follow any of the below steps to make this work

Option 1. Create an inputs.conf file in "$SPLUNK_HOME/etc/apps/CheckPointAnalyticsAppbyQOS/default/" and add below line to same file
[udp:514]
sourcetype=qos_syslog

Option 2. You can monitor you UDP port 514 for syslog and give sourcetype name as "qos_syslog". Document for same is available here http://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Data/Monitornetworkports

Option 3. Install our Add-on https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2996/
This will open UDP port 514 automatically and give its sourcetype as "qos_syslog".

li.span: Which Checkpoint Blades(Features) are supported by this app?
li.p: This App currently supports Firewall, IPS and Application/URL Control Blades. If you want us to add more blades Please mail us at splunk@qos.co.in

li.span: Is Checkpoint LEA app mandatory for this app to work?
li.p: No Check Point LEA Add-on is not mandatory for this App. There are two methods by which one can capture Check Point Firewall logs on Splunk.

Option 1. [Recommended] => https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/1454/
This Add-on uses the index file created using Checkpoint LEA app.

Option 2. https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/2996/
This Add-on should be used when Splunk indexer is running on Windows. We developed this App because Check Point LEA is not available on Windows.

li.span: Dashboard appears to be too slow. Is there any problem?
li.p: Here is the formula which determines the number of concurrent searches one can run at any point of time.
the total number of concurrent searches = base_max_searches + (# of cpus) * (max_searches_per_cpu)
base_max_searches and max_searches_per_cpu is defined in limits.conf file on your splunk server.
